resources.string: Please click on the appropriate button below.
(Optional) Please input your first name below.
Read the following for a summary of the purpose of each page accessible from the home screen dashboard. Visit the corresponding page for more detailed instructions or information.
- Return to this page for a ColorHead instructions summary.
- Make a new mathematical model for ColorHead.
- View one or more mathematical models available for ColorHead to use. Please either select one or go to New Model to make a new one.

- Here is where ColorHead can access your smartphone camera to obtain red, green, and blue color intensities of a sensor or indicator. Color will then use these color intensities to estimate the desired quantitative value. Please follow the instructions given on this page if you want ColorHead to use your smartphone camera. If you feel the estimate is inaccurate, see Help.

- Here is where ColorHead can obtain red, green, or blue color intensities from a sensor or indicator in an uploaded image. ColorHead will then use these color intensities to estimate the desired quantitative value. Please follow the instructions given on this page if you want ColorHead to use an uploaded image. If you feel the estimate is inaccurate, see Help.
Use the overflow menu on the right side of the toolbar above for the following.
- Reminder to read or reread Instructions (this page) if you are new or stuck at any point in using ColorHead
- Information about how ColorHead was made
- Information on the purpose of ColorHead and the possibility of future updates.
Fill out the text fields below to get started with a new model.
One or more models ready to use are listed below along with their corresponding performance statistics.
First, please click the button below that says camera so Color can access your phone camera. Then, ensure the sensor or indicator color fills the central square.
Once Color has access to your phone camera you should see your camera view here.

Click the Upload button below to choose an image to upload. Once your image is properly uploaded, it should appear below. Press your finger down on the image on the colored region of interest to obtain a corresponding reading estimate.
Once your image is properly uploaded, it should appear here.
This estimate seems inaccurate. What should I do?
If you are using your camera...
- Ensure the indicator or sensor color fills the central square in the camera view.
- Try uploading an image instead using your camera.
If you are uploading an image...
- Ensure it is cropped so the sensor or indicator color fills as much of the image as possible
- Try taking another picture and uploading again.lMake sure you are using an applicable model.
- Try using a more appropriate and/or accurate model.
What should I do if I am a new user or forgot how to do something?
- Go to Instructions using the navigation menu on the left side of the toolbar above.

This app was primarily made using Android Studio but many of Color\'s Java classes were originally written in Eclipse except for some classes relating to matrices and matrix operations obtained from Github. Various YouTube tutorials were also used as necessary during the app development.
The purpose of Color is to accurately translate the color of a sensor or indicator to a desired quantitative value such as ph or concentration.
Color may experience future updates to improve its accuracy and user experience. Possible updates include

Adding a virtual assistant possibly with voice activation and speaking abilities to guide users through the app or operate the app and read estimates of the desired quantitative value aloud for visually impaired users.
Adding more flexible mathematical modeling options
Automatically adjusting the position of the central square in the camera view
